0.title: Tamil Nadu lifts COVID-19 curbs, allows 500 people at weddings
0.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Wednesday further eased COVID-19 restrictions and allowed 500 persons to attend weddings and related events. A maximum of 250 people can attend funerals, Chief Minister MK Stalin-led government said. The government added that there are no restrictions on social, cultural and political gatherings. The relaxations will come into effect from Thursday.

1.title: Pic of Belarus President with a map of Russia's 'invasion plan' goes viral
1.article_body: An image of Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko pointing towards a map is going viral with reports claiming it displays the invasion plan in Ukraine. It allegedly shows Ukraine divided into four sections and lines of attack already carried out by Russia. According to New York Post, Lukashenko appeared to be talking about a planned attack from southern Ukraine into Moldova.

2.title: Ujjain creates Guinness World Record by lighting 11.71 lakh diyas
2.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain set a Guinness World Record of "largest display of oil lamps" by lighting 11.71 lakh earthen lamps as part of the Mahashivratri celebrations on March 1. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, "By...grace of Lord Mahakal...it's a privilege to create a unique record." Last year, Ayodhya had set the record by lighting over nine lakh diyas.

3.title: Don't foresee obstacles: Russia on S-400's delivery to India
3.article_body: Russia's Ambassador-designate to India Denis Alipov said he doesn't foresee any obstacles as far as delivery of five regiments of S-400 missile systems to India is concerned amid the sanctions levied on Russia after it invaded Ukraine. "Sanctions, old or new, don't interfere in any way," he said. He thanked India for 'balanced position' at the UN on the invasion.

4.title: UK to send additional £80 million in aid to Ukraine
4.article_body: The UK government on Tuesday said it has pledged another £80 million ($106.5 million) in aid to Ukraine. The government added this brings the UK's total aid to Ukraine up to £220 million. "Britain is at the forefront of efforts to supply life-saving humanitarian aid, as well as political, economic and defensive support," Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

5.title: If Samantha was an athlete, she would have been like Kohli: Trainer
5.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu's personal trainer Junaid Shaikh said he "always" tells Samantha, "If you were an athlete, you would have been like Virat Kohli." "Samantha...has an attitude wherein she will just say...'I will try and do it again'. She is very aggressive and wants to do things to the core," added Junaid. "I take motivation from her," he stated.

6.title: 61-yr-old man, wife get life imprisonment for killing relative in TN
6.article_body: A 61-year-old man and his 59-year-old wife were sentenced to life imprisonment for killing a relative in Tamil Nadu's Karur. In 2018, the couple engaged in a scuffle with their relative as he wanted to erect a fence around their home. The couple attacked him with a wooden log, following which he was taken to a hospital where he died.

7.title: Grateful to PM Modi for allowing Indians to return with pets from war-hit Ukraine: PETA
7.article_body: PETA India said it's grateful to PM Narendra Modi and Union Ministers Parshottam Rupala and Sanjeev Balyan "for including companion animals in the evacuation operation of Indians who are stuck in war-hit Ukraine" following its appeal. "Separating animal companions from their guardians would have resulted in more tragedy," PETA added. Earlier, a student refused to leave Ukraine without his pet.

8.title: Williamson is a very fun guy and listens to everyone: Abhishek Sharma
8.article_body: Terming SRH captain Kane Williamson as a "very fun guy" who listens to everyone, SRH all-rounder Abhishek Sharma said he has a "great understanding" with Williamson. "The quality that I like the most about Williamson is his composure and calmness in pressure situations," added Abhishek. Abhishek was bought by SRH for ₹6.5 crore in the mega auction.

9.title: Technology is a medium to empower the people of India: PM Modi
9.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said that technology is a medium to empower the people of the country, adding that it is the mainstay of making India self-reliant. While addressing a webinar on "technology-enabled development", the PM highlighted the expanding global market for gaming and said that the Budget has focussed on Animation, Visual Effects, Gaming and Comic (AVGC).

10.title: PWD to redevelop Delhi's accident-prone Rohtak Road
10.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) will redevelop the accident-prone Rohtak Road, which connects the Nangloi-Najafgarh crossing to the Tikri Border. The road safety cell of the transport department, in a study called 'Delhi Road Clash Fatalities Report', declared it unsafe for pedestrians and cyclists. The report states that in 2020 alone, 13 people were killed in hit-and-run cases.

11.title: Representations on crypto regulations have been made to govt: Ex-SEBI chief
11.article_body: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator has made representations to the government on regulation of cryptocurrencies in India. Tyagi said SEBI has been in discussion with the government since November 2021 and has made several representations. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in Budget 2022 that a 30% tax will be imposed on all virtual digital assets.

12.title: PCMC will have to recycle sewage water after 10-15 yrs: Ex-official
12.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad will have to recycle sewage water after 10-15 years amid growing population in the region, former joint city engineer of Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) Pravin Ladkat has said. Ladkat added that there are only three dams and no additional sources for water in Pimpri-Chinchwad. PCMC is planning to increase sewage treatment plants and their capacities, he further said.

13.title: Kohli is a great player, will come back and get hundreds: Ganguly
13.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli not scoring a century in international cricket since November 2019, Sourav Ganguly said Kohli is a "great" player who has batted marvellously and will get hundreds. "He has enormous ability," added Ganguly. Kohli will play his 100th Test when India take on Sri Lanka in the first Test, with Ganguly terming it as a "fantastic landmark".

14.title: Russia banned from tennis team events; players allowed in ATP, WTA events
14.article_body: Russia has been banned from participating in team events, while players are allowed to compete in Grand Slams and regular ATP and WTA events but not using Russia's flag or name. "The international governing bodies of tennis stand united in our condemnation of Russia's actions," a joint statement by the International Tennis Federation (ITF), the ATP and the WTA said.

15.title: Indians in Ukraine may have miscalculated situation despite advisory: Fadnavis
15.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday said India had issued an advisory days before the Russian invasion in Ukraine but Indian students may have miscalculated the gravity of the situation. He was asked if there was a delay in evacuation on the government's part. Opposition parties have been criticising the government after a student from Karnataka was killed in Ukraine.

16.title: Ukraine's Zinchenko captains Man City in their 2-0 FA Cup 5th round win
16.article_body: Manchester City on Tuesday beat Peterborough United 2-0 in fifth round to reach the quarter-finals of the FA Cup. Riyad Mahrez scored City's first goal before Jack Grealish scored his first ever FA Cup goal. Manchester City were captained by Ukraine international Oleksandr Zinchenko, who made his first appearance for the club since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began last week.

17.title: Pune wildlife researcher Dharmaraj Patil dies aged 42 after illness
17.article_body: Wildlife researcher and environment educator Dharmaraj Patil has passed away aged 42 in Pune, Maharashtra, following a brief illness. The ornithologist was also a poet and an author and his research work included a study on critically endangered Forest Owlet and endemic birds of Northern Western Ghats. He died on Tuesday, and his last rites were performed at Vaikunth crematorium.

18.title: Canada bans Russian-owned ships from entering its ports
18.article_body: Canada on Tuesday said it will ban all Russian-owned ships from entering its ports following the invasion of Ukraine. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Monday said Canada will ban crude oil imports from Russia. Government officials said they are tracking three Russian-flagged vessels off Canada's east coast. Canada imported $1.68 billion worth of goods from Russia in 2021.

19.title: Inflation hits all-time-high of 5.8% in 19 nations using euro
19.article_body: Consumer inflation in the 19 countries that use the euro currency increased by an annual 5.8% in February 2022,  European Union statistics agency Eurostat said on Wednesday. It's the highest level since recordkeeping for the euro started in 1997. Inflation in Europe, as in other major economies, has been increasing by surging energy prices following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

20.title: Ashneer shares pic of bed made on floor after BharatPe's 'lavish lifestyle' allegation
20.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday took to LinkedIn to share a picture of a bed made on the floor following BharatPe's allegations against him of committing fraud to fund his "lavish lifestyle". "I indeed have a very lavish lifestyle. I get invited by friends with open hearts to their homes, where I have no qualms sleeping on the floor," wrote Ashneer.

21.title: Passport helps save life of 16-yr-old Ukrainian boy amid war, pic goes viral
21.article_body: A 16-year-old boy's life was saved after a piece of shrapnel got stuck in his passport in Ukraine's Mariupol amid war with Russia. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a picture of the passport and wrote that the boy is in surgery now. "Praying for his full and speedy recovery," a user commented on the picture.

22.title: No longer have to knock at directors' door: Anchal on 'Yeh Kaali...'
22.article_body: Actress Anchal Singh has said she can finally relax after doing 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein'. She added, "I no longer have to knock at the door of directors and say, 'Sir, I have done this, I have done that, and I have done that too'." "From a nobody to this Anchal Singh, this journey has been quite long," she said.

23.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor's film to release on March 8, 2023
23.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Luv Films announced that director Luv Ranjan's untitled next, starring actor Ranbir Kapoor, will release on March 8, 2023. The film will also feature actress Shraddha Kapoor. Luv Ranjan and Ankur Garg will produce the film. This will be the first time that Ranbir and Shraddha will work together in a film.

24.title: 2 men killed, 2 others injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
24.article_body: Two men were killed and two others were severely injured in an accident on the Delhi-Haridwar highway on Tuesday night, police said. The four friends from Ghaziabad were going to Haridwar to take bath in the Ganga when another car hit the car in which they were travelling, resulting in the death of two. The injured persons have been hospitalised.

25.title: Leave Ukraine's Kharkiv immediately for your safety: India to its nationals
25.article_body: Amid reports of heavy shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Indian Embassy in Ukraine advised all its nationals to leave Kharkiv immediately "for their safety and security". They have been told to proceed to Pesochin, Babaye and Bezlyudovka as soon as possible and reach these settlements by 6 pm (Ukrainian time) on Wednesday "under all circumstances".

26.title: Nigeria to airlift hundreds stranded by war in Ukraine
26.article_body: Nigeria said it's sending three jets to bring back nearly 1,300 citizens stranded in Ukraine's neighbouring nations after fleeing the war. "First batch of evacuees are expected to arrive...on Thursday," it added. African countries have been scrambling to help their citizens living in Ukraine amid reports of racism and being blocked from crossing the borders into Poland, Romania and Hungary.

27.title: Nawab Malik being framed for calling Aryan innocent: Maha NCP Chief
27.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil on Wednesday said NCP leader Nawab Malik is being framed as he revealed that "Aryan Khan was framed". Actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan was arrested in connection with a drugs raid conducted by the Narcotics Control Bureau on October 3 last year. He was accused of consumption and possession of drugs.

28.title: Each vote cast in UP will take BJP towards record victory: PM Modi
28.article_body: Addressing rally in UP's Ghazipur on Wednesday, PM Narendra Modi said that each vote cast in UP Assembly elections will take BJP towards record victory. Every vote will give "befitting" response to "pariwarwadi" (dynastic) parties, that had altered UP's identity and made state famous for 'mafia', he added. Sixth phase polling for 57 UP Assembly seats will be held tomorrow.

29.title: From boyfriend-girlfriend to mom-dad: Preity on her 6th wedding anniversary
29.article_body: Actress Preity Zinta recently celebrated her wedding anniversary with her husband Gene Goodenough. Sharing a picture from their wedding day on Instagram, Preity wrote, "Happy Anniversary my Love. I love you. Thank you...for loving all of me and for making me laugh all the time. You are my best friend & confidant...From Boyfriend-girlfriend to husband-wife and now mom-dad."

30.title: To my inspiration & role model: Rakul Preet Singh wishes dad on his b'day
30.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh wished her father Kulvinder Singh on his birthday. Taking to Instagram, Rakul Preet wrote, "Happy birthday to my inspiration, my role model. I look up to you every single day for the fearless strong person you are, for all the knowledge and wisdom you have. I'm the luckiest to have you guide me through everything."

31.title: Maha govt saving Nawab Malik who helped Mumbai blasts accused Dawood: Fadnavis
31.article_body: Calling for Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting him. "People whose hands are stained with the blood of innocent people who died in the Mumbai blast are being supported by the Shiv Sena-led government," he said. Malik was involved in money laundering with bomb blast accused Dawood Ibrahim, he said.

32.title: 22-year-old Indian student dies in Ukraine days after suffering stroke
32.article_body: Chandan Jindal, a 22-year-old student studying at the National Pirogov Memorial Medical University in Ukraine's Vinnytsia, passed away at a hospital in the city today. He hailed from Punjab's Barnala. He had suffered an Ischemic stroke in February and was admitted to the ICU. His father has written to Indian government to make arrangements for bringing back his body.

33.title: Maha govt refuses to allow unvaccinated persons to board Mumbai local trains
33.article_body: The Maharashtra government informed the Bombay High Court on Wednesday that it won't allow people not vaccinated against COVID-19 to board local trains in Mumbai. Last month, HC had asked the government to "let bygones be bygones" and start afresh. Expressing disappointment at the order, HC said today that almost all activities in Mumbai are being performed like pre-pandemic days.

34.title: Ukrainian refugees to get EU protection for up to 3 years: Germany
34.article_body: The German government has said that the European Union will offer immediate protection to refugees from Ukraine for up to three years. "We will provide help quickly and without bureaucracy. Refugees from Ukraine do not need to go through the asylum procedure," Germany's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser said. They will also get access to health insurance and jobs, she added.

35.title: 25-yr-old unidentified man killed, set on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur
35.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and set on fire by an unidentified miscreant near Yashoda Nagar bypass in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The unidentified victim's half-burnt body was recovered by the locals in the area after they spotted flames emanating from a hut. Before setting the victim's body ablaze, the accused had crushed his head and face with bricks, police said.

36.title: DK Shivakumar apologises for traffic jams in B'luru amid Mekedatu rally
36.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar has apologised for traffic jams caused due to Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru. Shivakumar said, "I want to apologise to the people of Bengaluru...There may be traffic trouble for three days...but it will solve your water-related issues for the next 50 years." "Our fight is for the people of [Karnataka] and citizens of Bengaluru," he added.

37.title: People knew I battled drug abuse; they wouldn't offer me jobs: Prateik
37.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar said at his lowest phase in his career, he was "rejected by people many times". Prateik added for two years, he worked in plays "for free". "It was my own doing and my own battles that I was fighting...People [knew] about the substance and alcohol abuse I battled...[they] were wary of working with me," Prateik said.

38.title: Making Hrithik talk without moving a limb in Guzaarish was courage: Bhansali
38.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said lot of people felt his filmmaking was moving in the same direction. He added, "They had almost written off my career after...'Guzaarish'." Bhansali added he was fearless when he made 'Guzaarish'. "I [took Hrithik Roshan], who's considered...Greek God in Hindi cinema, who's known for dancing and action...[Making him talk] without moving a limb...was courage," he said.

39.title: SC to hear plea seeking FIR against political parties for bribing voters
39.article_body: The Supreme Court said it would hear a plea on Thursday seeking direction to register FIRs against political parties for inducing voters by offering freebies. "Election bribing is taking place everywhere...It's not for a particular state," CJI NV Ramana said. The plea demands disqualification of all members of Congress, SP in UP and AAP candidates in Punjab in Assembly election.

40.title: Google, Meta may face penalty for failing to open local offices in Russia
40.article_body: Google and Meta are among the firms that may face possible punitive measures in Russia over failure to open local offices and take other measures required by a communications law. The law requires foreign social media firms with over 5,00,000 daily users to open local offices. Besides Google and Meta, TikTok, Zoom and Twitter have also not established local offices.

41.title: It's not war, it's like India's surgical strike: India-born legislator from Putin's party
41.article_body: Indian-origin legislator and member of Russian President Vladimir Putin's party, Dr Abhay Kumar Singh, has come out in support of the military action against Ukraine. In an interview with Aaj Tak, he said, "This is not war; it's like India's surgical strike." "If the military enters a supermarket and...attacks Russian soldiers, we'll have to reply," he stated.

42.title: Google, MeitY list 100 Indian startups that'll get help to build apps
42.article_body: Google and India's Ministry of Electronics and IT's Startup Hub have unveiled the inaugural cohort of 100 Indian startups as part of Appscale Academy. The initiative aims to help startups build high-quality global apps and games. The startups were chosen from over 400 applications following a selection process that took into account their creative ideas and innovation, among other things.

43.title: Who is Joshua Davis, the 13-year-old boy who went viral after Biden's speech?
43.article_body: US President Joe Biden mentioned Joshua Davis, who attended his State of the Union speech, while discussing the need to cap insulin prices. Joshua was diagnosed with Type-1 diabetes when he was 11 months old and has raised awareness about the same since he was 4. During his speech, Biden wished Joshua, who turned 13 on Monday, a "happy birthday".

44.title: Samasta Hindu Aghadi chief Milind Ekbote booked for spreading misinformation
44.article_body: Samasta Hindu Aghadi's chief Milind Ekbote and 20 others were booked for distributing provocative pamphlets and circulating misinformation on social media to drive a wedge between two communities. The accused misled people about construction work at a Muslim shrine near Punyeshwar Mahadev Temple in Pune despite a court's stay and performed rituals there on Mahashivratri, the police said.

45.title: Kolkata woman raped by tantric on pretext of curing her ailing husband
45.article_body: An astrologer-cum-tantric was arrested for raping a woman on the pretext of curing her ailing husband in Kolkata's Chitpur. The woman alleged that the accused claimed he would perform yagnas to save her husband and took her to different places for performing rituals. She told police, he spiked her drink and raped her on two occasions when she became unconscious.

46.title: Russia's largest lender Sberbank to exit Europe, cites abnormal cash outflows
46.article_body: Russia's largest lender Sberbank is leaving almost all European markets after coming under pressure of Western sanctions that were imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The group's subsidiary banks have faced abnormal cash outflows and threats to the safety of its employees and branches," it said. Earlier, the European Central Bank (ECB) ordered the closure of Sberbank's European arm.

47.title: Madras HC closes contempt case linked to river linking project
47.article_body: Madras High Court has closed a contempt case filed in 2017 by DMK leader M Appavu in connection with Tamil Nadu's Thamirabarani-Karumeniyar-Nambiar river linking project. There is no wilful disobedience of an order passed in 2015 with regard to the implementation of the project, HC said. No case is made out for initiating contempt proceedings, HC added.

48.title: Vehicles stuck in traffic for 4 hrs amid Mekedatu rally in B'luru: Report
48.article_body: Several vehicles were stuck in traffic snarl for about four hours due to the Congress' Mekedatu Padayatra in Bengaluru, a report stated. Meanwhile, Bengaluru Police has deployed about 1,000 policemen across the city following the Congress rally. Furthermore, the police has also issued an advisory of alternative routes for commuters to avoid getting stuck in traffic jams in the city.

49.title: We're ready for 2nd round of talks, not sure if Ukraine will join: Russia
49.article_body: Russian officials are ready to hold a second round of talks with Ukraine on Wednesday, but it's unclear whether the "Ukrainian negotiators will show up or not", Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday had said that Russia must stop bombing Ukrainian cities before more talks on a ceasefire could take place.

50.title: I clicked Alia & Ranbir's 1st picture when she was just 9: Bhansali
50.article_body: Sanjay Leela Bhansali said he clicked Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's first picture together when she was just nine years old during Black's shoot. Bhansali added, "[I told Alia to] put her head on Ranbir's shoulders. She said 'no', she was...shy." "I [was] talking to Soni (Razdan) and suddenly I [saw] her head...on...Ranbir's shoulder...I [still] have that picture," he added.

51.title: DU female teacher says 2 colleagues harassed her; NCW writes to VC
51.article_body: A female teacher of Delhi University has accused her two male colleagues of harassing her and misbehaving with her. She alleged that the two teachers humiliated her by trying to stop her from attending a governing body meeting. The National Commission for Women has written to the Delhi University Vice-Chancellor to send an action taken report at the earliest.

52.title: 28-yr-old kills girlfriend in Delhi hotel over suspicion of affair
52.article_body: A 28-year-old man has been arrested from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly killing his girlfriend in Hotel Lak Residency in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area, police said on Tuesday. During interrogation, the accused revealed he killed the woman because she had been deceiving him and was in a relationship with another man, Deputy Commissioner of Police (southwest) Gaurav Sharma said.

53.title: People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan can never strengthen India: PM
53.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said those who make fun of 'Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan' can never strengthen India. "People who mock Atmanirbhar Abhiyan, insult our (defence) forces...such dynasts can never strengthen India," PM Modi said while addressing a rally in Sonbhadra. "They are the same people who spread rumours about the country's COVID-19 vaccine," PM Modi added.

54.title: Even if Ishan performs with 60-70% of his ability, he'll be in team: Bangar
54.article_body: Former Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that Ishan Kishan will be India's top choice for the opening role at the T20 World Cup even if he performs with 60-70 per cent of his ability. "He plays with a strike rate which India need at the top order...he also provides the right-left combination at the top," Bangar explained.

55.title: Mumbai to soon get ward-wise helpline numbers for civic complaints
55.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is launching ward-wise helpline numbers to help citizens register civic complaints. The numbers for each of the 24 wards will be launched after current term of corporators ends on March 7. The helpline will address civic issues directly, a BMC official said. The existing helpline number 1916 will continue to operate, the official added.

56.title: Trinamool Congress wins 93 of 107 municipalities in WB civic polls
56.article_body: CM Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress on Wednesday steamrolled the Opposition by winning 93 of 107 municipalities in the civic polls, an SEC official said. TMC also won from Kanthi, the bastion of Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari. Congratulating the winners and thanking voters, Banerjee tweeted, "Let victory enhance our responsibility and dedication. Let triumph impart humility."

57.title: 3 armed men rob 2 men of their valuables during morning walk in UP
57.article_body: Three armed men robbed two men of their valuables during their morning walk in the Sector 11 market area in Ghaziabad's Vasundhara in UP on Tuesday, police said. "All the three men pulled out guns...made me take off my gold ring at gunpoint...snatched [my friend's] gold chain...asked him to take off his gold ring," one of the victims said.

58.title: Tons of space junk likely to punch a 20-metre deep hole in Moon
58.article_body: A leftover rocket weighing three tons is expected to smash into the side of the moon that faces away from the Earth at a speed of 9,300 kph on March 4. Scientists think this impact would likely carve out a hole 10 to 20 meters deep in the surface of the moon. Experts believe the junk rocket belongs to China.

59.title: RJD calls Bihar govt's new liquor order 'ridiculous'
59.article_body: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) criticised the Nitish Kumar-led government's announcement that people caught drinking alcohol will not be jailed but will be asked to share information on the liquor mafia and called it "ridiculous". The announcement proves that the liquor prohibition policy has failed in Bihar and it should be ended, RJD spokesperson Mrityunjay Tiwary said.

60.title: Alert sounded in Mumbai-bound flight after man smokes cigar mid-air
60.article_body: A smoke alert was sounded in a Mumbai-bound flight after a 36-year-old man lit up cigar mid-air in the plane's bathroom. Subsequently, the plane's crew rushed to the bathroom, extinguished the cigar and asked the man to be seated. The man, who said he hadn't acted deliberately but was only curious, was later arrested for endangering the life of others.

61.title: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals in Ukraine have been relocated: Official
61.article_body: Over 2,500 Chinese nationals stranded in Ukraine have been moved out of the country, Chinese Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Wang Wenbin said on Wednesday. Chinese citizens reportedly travelled from Kyiv and Odessa, among other places, to Poland, Slovakia and Moldova. Around 6,000 Chinese nationals resided in Ukraine either for education or work purposes.

62.title: Avesh Khan should receive same backing as Siraj: Irfan Pathan
62.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said pacer Avesh Khan should receive the same backing as Mohammed Siraj received from ex-captain Virat Kohli. "Kohli should be credited for the confidence with which Siraj bowls in international cricket. So yes, players need that backing. And I believe Avesh should [also] receive backing...because he has that talent," Irfan stated.

63.title: 7 teams formed to probe murder of 3 CNG station employees in Gurugram
63.article_body: Gurugram Police on Tuesday said seven teams have been formed to probe murder of three employees of a CNG station on a service lane off NH-48 in Sector 31. We're scanning footage of over 100 CCTV cameras, added the police. "Suspects were armed with sharp-edged weapons and didn't take much time to attack and flee," said ACP (Crime) Preet Pal.

64.title: Video of pre-wedding festivities of Supriya Pathak's daughter Sanah surfaces
64.article_body: A video from the pre-wedding festivities of actress Sanah Kapur, who will be marrying Mayank Pahwa, son of actor Manoj Pahwa, has surfaced. The video shows Sanah's mother and actress Supriya Pathak dancing with her sister and actress Ratna Pathak Shah. Pankaj Kapur had, on Monday, said, "I don't want to talk much, but yes it is my daughter's wedding."

65.title: US troops in Europe not to fight in Ukraine, but to defend allies: Biden
65.article_body: US President Joe Biden said American troops were deployed to Europe not to fight in Ukraine, "but to defend our NATO allies [if]...Russian President Vladimir Putin decides to keep moving west". The US has deployed troops to many NATO countries, including Poland, Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia. Earlier, Biden had said that Putin wants to "re-establish the former Soviet Union".

66.title: 1,080 kg of sea cucumber worth crores seized in Tamil Nadu
66.article_body: Based on a tip-off, Coastal Security Group of Tamil Nadu Police conducted a raid at an old building near Akkaraipettai on Tuesday and seized sea cucumbers worth crores in international market. They recovered 248 kg and 812 kg of preserved and unpreserved sea cucumbers respectively, along with 4 kg preserved sea horses and 15 kg shark wings during the raid.

67.title: Constable on poll duty killed, 11 others injured in Manipur accident
67.article_body: An India Reserve Battalion (IRB) constable was killed and 11 others were injured in an accident in Manipur's Tamenglong district. They were reportedly going for poll duty to Manipur from Mizoram. Five of the injured were flown to Imphal for treatment. According to police, the driver might have lost control of the vehicle as the road was narrow.

68.title: If World War 3 takes place, it will involve nuclear weapons: Russia
68.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that if World War 3 were to take place, it would involve nuclear weapons and be destructive. Lavrov further said that Russia would face a "real danger" if Ukraine acquired nuclear weapons. This comes a week after Russia ordered military operation in Ukraine.

69.title: Liquor vendors move HC against Delhi govt's order stopping discount on alcohol
69.article_body: A group of private liquor license holders have approached the Delhi High Court challenging the Delhi government's February 28 order which barred them from giving discounts on alcohol. The government said the decision was taken in view of overcrowding at liquor shops. "The rules of the game cannot be changed after the game has begun," the petitioners said.

70.title: UGC draft rules allow institutes to source 40% content externally for online degrees
70.article_body: Institutes offering online degrees can source up to 40% of their course content externally and develop the remaining 60% in-house, as per UGC draft guidelines. This will prevent students from putting extra effort in locating good online programmes to pursue, a senior UGC official said. "The institutes themselves will do the research and provide options to students," the official added.

71.title: He's shaping up well: Bumrah on Ashwin's fitness ahead of Mohali Test
71.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has provided an update on Ravichandran Ashwin's fitness ahead of the Mohali Test against Sri Lanka, starting on March 4. "Ashwin is shaping up well...I'm not aware [if] there are any complaints...He was bowling, batting, fielding, he did everything," stated Bumrah. Ashwin was ruled out of the West Indies series due to an unknown injury.

72.title: Russia to investigate 21-yr-old Indian student's death in Ukraine: Russian envoy
72.article_body: Russia will investigate the death of the 21-year-old Indian medical student in Ukraine's Kharkiv, Russian Ambassador-designate Denis Alipov said on Wednesday. Alipov offered his "deepest condolences" over the death of Naveen Gyanagoudar and conveyed his sympathy to the student's family in Karnataka. "Russia will do everything to ensure the safety of Indians in conflict zones," he added.

73.title: Russian soldiers punching holes in their vehicles, crying, firing at each other: Reports
73.article_body: Russian troops in Ukraine are suffering from low morale and have deliberately punched holes in their vehicles' gas tanks, a Pentagon official said, reported New York Times. They are reportedly also suffering from food and fuel shortages. Voice recordings obtained by a British intelligence company reveal they were heard crying and sometimes even firing at each other, said reports.

74.title: Pathaan time starts now: SRK shares release date of his film 'Pathaan'
74.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce that his film 'Pathaan' will release on January 25, 2023 in theatres, adding, "I know it's late, but remember the date. Pathaan time starts now." 'Pathaan' also stars Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. 'Pathaan' marks Deepika's fourth film with Shah Rukh, having made her debut alongside him in 'Om Shanti Om'.

75.title: US sanctions on Russia won't affect us significantly: IAF Vice Chief
75.article_body: Vice Chief of Air Staff Air Marshal Sandeep Singh on Wednesday said US sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Russia-Ukraine war "won't affect us significantly". "Things are still unfolding. Our position is very strong and our relations with both the countries have remained (strong)," Singh said. He added that India's "relations with Russia will continue" despite a difficult geopolitical situation.

76.title: Robberies, rapes rising in Ukraine as govt arms civilians amid war: Man in video
76.article_body: In a video filmed in Kyiv on February 28, a man claimed that criminals in Ukraine have got their hands on military-grade weapons after President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's regime declared that it would arm all civilians willing to fight against Russia. "There have been robberies, rapes and all kinds of havoc due to this," he said.

77.title: Child cancer patients sheltered in basement in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid war
77.article_body: A video has emerged that shows child cancer patients sheltering in a basement in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, amid the Russian invasion. Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko shared the video on Twitter and wrote, "Little cancer patients in Kharkiv basement. These are unfit conditions for children who suffer enough as it is already!"

78.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released, Shreyas Iyer jumps 27 spots
78.article_body: The ICC today released the latest rankings for T20I batters, with India's Shreyas Iyer jumping 27 spots to be ranked 18th. Meanwhile, KL Rahul dropped four spots to be ranked 10th. He is the only Indian in the top 10. Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka moved up six spots to be ranked ninth in the rankings led by Pakistan's Babar Azam.

79.title: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
79.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.

80.title: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
80.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.

81.title: Pending bills worth ₹800 cr for traffic violations in Hyd: T'gana Police
81.article_body: Telangana Police said that pending bills for traffic violations amount to ₹1,500 crore in the state as nearly five crore challans remain unpaid by citizens. Hyderabad accounts for ₹800 crore worth of pending bills for traffic violations, it added. Most of them pertain to the last two years, some of the challans date back to 2014, Hyderabad Police stated.

82.title: Hyd software employee posts fake ad to rent out area on Quikr; held
82.article_body: A software employee has been apprehended for allegedly giving fake advertisements on Quikr and taking advance payments from people in Hyderabad. Police have seized a car and an iPhone from him. The accused gave an advertisement on the online platform about an office with a 2,400-square feet area and quoted ₹35,000 as rent and ₹50,000 as advance for it.

83.title: Never cheated in my relationship, might've been cheated upon: Ananya
83.article_body: Speaking about infidelity, actress Ananya Panday said she has never cheated in a relationship. "Maybe I have been cheated upon but I'm not sure," she added. Ananya's 'Gehraiyaan' co-star Siddhant Chaturvedi also said he's never cheated in a relationship. "It has to be...black or white for me. I cannot live in the grey area. It messes things up," he added.

84.title: Taiwan leaders to donate 1 month's salary for Ukraine relief measures
84.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said on Wednesday that she, Vice President William Lai and Premier Su Tseng-chang will each donate their one month's salary towards humanitarian efforts in war-torn Ukraine. President Tsai receives around $14,250 (₹10.7 lakh) per month as remuneration, Reuters reported. Additionally, the Taiwanese government has sent 27 tonnes of medical supplies to Ukraine.

85.title: Govt working day & night for you: Union Minister to Indian evacuees from Ukraine
85.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Wednesday welcomed Indian nationals evacuated from Ukraine, in Delhi. "All of you have come with a sad memory to India. Many of you must not have been able to sleep for hours, days…Government working day and night for you," Shekhawat said while interacting with the evacuees.

86.title: Stop asking me questions on Russian invasion: Chelsea manager Tuchel
86.article_body: Reacting to a question by a journalist on the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Chelsea manager Thomas Tuchel said, "How often do I need to say it? It's horrible. You have to stop asking me these questions." "Everybody in Europe has some noise in their head that nobody likes," added Tuchel. "We have the right to focus on sports," he stated.

87.title: It is a crime to play a dot ball in T20s: Shreyas Iyer
87.article_body: Shreyas Iyer said it is a "crime" to play a dot ball in T20s adding that players need to work on intent. Shreyas was the highest run-scorer in India's T20I series against Sri Lanka, scoring 204 runs at a strike rate of 174.35. He will lead KKR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹12.25 crore in the mega auction.

88.title: State Election Commission acting as slave to WB govt: BJP’s Anirban Ganguly
88.article_body: BJP leader Anirban Ganguly criticised WB CM Mamata Banerjee for the alleged violence during civic body polls and said the State Election Commission is acting as a "slave" to the WB government. "The Supreme Court and the Kolkata HC should introspect (the alleged violence) because when we filed a plea seeking deployment of Central security forces...It was dismissed," Ganguly added.

89.title: Mumbai Police summons Narayan Rane & son in Disha Salian case
89.article_body: The Mumbai Police has sent a notice to Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son Nitesh Rane, asking them to record statements this week in connection to the Disha Salian death case. An FIR was registered against the duo for allegedly spreading false information about Salian's death. Salian was the former manager of late Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput.

90.title: BBPV demands reduction of bus fares in Bengaluru in state Budget
90.article_body: Bengaluru Bus Prayanikara Vedike has started a petition demanding reduction in bus fares and making travel free for women, transgenders and senior citizens. It asked the state government to allocate ₹1,000 crore to Bangalore Metropolitan Transport Corporation in the upcoming state Budget to reduce the fare. BMTC fares, the highest in India, are strangling the working class, the petition read.

91.title: 21-yr-old Indian student's friends sent pic of his dead body from Ukraine: K'taka CM
91.article_body: After 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen was killed in shelling in Ukraine, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Naveen's friends have sent a photo of his body, sending it to MEA to confirm the same." Adding that Naveen's family will be compensated, CM Bommai said, "We're in touch with the Indian Embassy so that at least the body is secured."

92.title: Tamil Nadu govt releases examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12
92.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Department of School Education has released the examination schedule for classes 10, 11 and 12. The examination for class 10 will be held from May 6 to May 30 and the examination for class 12 will be held from May 5 to May 28. The examination for class 11 will be held from May 10 to May 31.

93.title: India able to evacuate citizens from Ukraine due to its rising power: PM
93.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said it's because of India's rising power that the government is able to evacuate its citizens from Ukraine. "Those who questioned valour of armed forces and 'Make in India' can't make country strong," he said at a rally in UP's Sonbhadra. He added that the government is making all efforts to evacuate citizens from Ukraine.

94.title: Sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 begins in Bay of Bengal
94.article_body: The sea phase of multilateral naval exercise MILAN-22 commenced in the Bay of Bengal on Tuesday. A total of 26 ships, 21 aircraft and one submarine are participating in the event which includes weapon firings and seamanship evolutions, among other exercises. The event aims at enhancing interoperability and maritime cooperation while sharing best practices among the participating navies.

95.title: Russia sees no desire from Ukraine to find legitimate solution: Envoy
95.article_body: Russian ambassador to UN Gennady Gatilov said Moscow sees "no desire on the part of Ukraine" to reach a legitimate and balanced solution to the problems between the countries. Russia "supports diplomacy based on respect for the positions of all countries and equality, but for now, we don't see that", he added. Russia and Ukraine held peace talks on Monday.

96.title: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacts with parents of students stuck in Ukraine
96.article_body: MoS MEA V Muraleedharan interacted with parents of students who are stranded in several parts of Ukraine amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. He also updated the parents on the ongoing rescue operations under Operation Ganga. The meeting reportedly happened in Pune. Meanwhile, Union Ministers Smriti Irani, Gajendra Shekhawat and Rajeev Chandrasekhar welcomed Indians as they returned from Ukraine.

97.title: Honda suspends car, motorcycle exports to Russia amid invasion
97.article_body: Honda has suspended its automobile and motorcycle exports to Russia, amid growing sanctions on Russia in protest against its invasion of Ukraine. A Honda spokesperson said exports to Russia were already suspended as of Wednesday. The firm's suspension is reportedly based on complications with its distribution networks and concerns surrounding sanctions against Russia.

98.title: Robbers raid house posing as IT officials near B'luru; steal ₹35 lakh
98.article_body: Six men conducted a raid at a tomato trader's house near Bengaluru after posing as Income Tax officials and robbed him of ₹35 lakh cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh. The robbers reportedly said they had orders to search the house and showed him files with CBI imprints. However, they later threatened the trader with knife after he got suspicious.

99.title: NDMC to provide scholarship to children of sanitation workers
99.article_body: The New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) has decided to provide 'Palika Swachchta Scholarship' to help children of sanitation workers get admission to professional courses. "This scholarship will help...children in getting admission in medical, engineering and UPSC coaching or preparation," an official said. It will be implemented from the academic year 2022-2023, NDMC member Kuljeet Chahal said.

100.title: Pic of Indian girl carrying her pet dog from Ukraine amid war goes viral
100.article_body: A picture of Indian Medical student Arya Aldrin carrying her pet dog Zaira from Ukraine amid war is going viral on social media. The duo reportedly crossed over to Romania. Kerala Minister V Sivankutty praised her online and wrote, "Without abandoning her pet dog, Arya is on her way to India from a war-torn country...the world benefits from such love."

101.title: 4 die while cleaning septic tank at Pune residential building
101.article_body: Four people died due to suffocation while cleaning a septic tank at a residential building in Pune's Kadam Wak Wasti area on Wednesday, police said. The victims include those who were engaged in cleaning and those who look after the functioning of the residential colony. One of the deceased has been identified, the police said.

102.title: We were sleepless, listening to stories of pain: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir...'
102.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi said she and director Vivek Agnihotri "were just listening to stories of the pain" before the 'The Kashmir Files' was rolled out. "Vivek and I used to reach back to hotel...gaze at ceiling...we were sleepless for hours...It was impossible to emotionally unwind...I told Vivek I was going back...I wasn't able to take more pain," Joshi said.

103.title: Ukraine to receive more missiles & Turkish drones: Defence Min
103.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Wednesday said the country was set to receive Stinger and Javelin missiles from abroad and another shipment of Turkish drones. Many Western countries have pledged to give or sell weapons to Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukraine said that more than 350 Ukrainians, including 14 children, have been killed in the conflict so far.

104.title: Can send 4 aircraft a day, each bringing 200 people from Ukraine: IAF
104.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Wednesday said that it can send four aircraft in a day to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine. "200 people will be brought back in one round," Vice Chief of Air Staff Sandeep Singh said. "Three IAF aircraft have been sent since morning to evacuate Indians. Relief materials are also being sent," he added.

105.title: Have readied SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency: Ukrainian engineer
105.article_body: A Ukrainian engineer, Oleg Kutkov, said he has readied his SpaceX Starlink dish for emergency use in case regular broadband services are cut amid war. "It's possible that...local internet infrastructure will be destroyed. This would be the emergency state," he said. Earlier, Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov had shared an image of SpaceX Starlink terminals that arrived in Ukraine.

106.title: RPI(A) wants to contest 39 seats in PCMC elections: Ramdas Athawale
106.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (A) chief Ramdas Athawale said on Tuesday that his party is keen to contest 39 seats in the upcoming Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) polls. Athawale added that wherever RPI (A) has "strong candidates", party should be given tickets. "Our alliance [with BJP] will once again come to power in Pimpri-Chinchwad," he further said.

107.title: Godman gets 7-yr-jail for kidnapping & locking up Mumbai boy in 2015
107.article_body: A 57-year-old man, who had dressed as a Godman and kidnapped a 13-year-old boy from Mumbai in 2015, was sentenced to seven years imprisonment by a court in Dindoshi. The accused had taken the boy to Varanasi and kept him locked in a room for over four months. The victim was traced after a co-passenger on the train got suspicious.

108.title: Primary school kids arrested in Russia over anti-war signs, claims Opposition politician
108.article_body: Primary school children have been arrested at an anti-war protest in Russia, according to an Opposition politician. Ilya Yashin shared what appeared to be pictures of three children holding 'no to war' placard in the back of a police van. "Nothing out of the ordinary: just kids in paddy wagons behind an anti-war poster. This is Putin's Russia," he tweeted.

109.title: Olympian Stanislav takes up arms to fight Russia, says 'We'll kill every occupant'
109.article_body: Ukraine's Stanislav Mykolayovych Horuna, who bagged a bronze medal in karate at Tokyo Olympics, has taken up arms to fight Russia amid war with Ukraine."We will kill every occupant who invades," he wrote on Instagram. The 33-year-old also asked his followers on Instagram to donate to support the Ukrainian Army.

110.title: Oil price crosses $110 mark, reaches highest level since July 2014
110.article_body: Crude oil price hit its highest level since July 2014 as it rose past the $110/barrel mark on Wednesday as sanctions imposed on Russia continued to mount. Brent crude rose over 5.8% to $111.09/barrel, its highest since July 2014. US West Texas Intermediate jumped nearly 6% to $109.30/barrel, its highest since September 2013.

111.title: I just work and sleep, I last saw my family 3 days ago: Ukraine's President
111.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, when asked about his life amid the Russian invasion, in an interview said, "I work and sleep, that's it." When asked about whether he can see his family and kids, the Ukrainian President said, "No, I can't." He added that he last saw his family three days ago, in the middle of the war.

112.title: Ashneer's wife says 'time to move on', deletes tweets & videos against BharatPe
112.article_body: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain, who was recently fired by BharatPe, deleted tweets and videos criticising the activities of the company's top officials. "We stand by each of our statements but it's time for us to move ahead towards positivity and away from...endless media drama," she said. She also deleted an alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Bhavik Koladiya abusing Ashneer.

113.title: This is what 'Russian peace' looks like: Ukraine on video of missile in Kharkiv
113.article_body: The Defence of Ukraine's official Twitter account on Wednesday shared a video of a Russian missile striking the National Police building in Kharkiv. It also tweeted, "This is what 'Russian peace' looks like." This comes a day after a Russian strike on Kyiv's TV tower killed at least five people.

114.title: Only thing lavish is my dreams: Ashneer on BharatPe's 'fraud for lavish lifestyle' allegation
114.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday reacted to BharatPe's allegation of "fraud to fund a lavish lifestyle", by saying, "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams and ability to achieve them against all odds through hard work and enterprise." He added, "I'd want to learn who among Amarchand, PwC and A&M started doing an audit on 'lavishness' of one's lifestyle?"

115.title: Jason Roy takes indefinite break from cricket after pulling out of IPL 2022
115.article_body: England batter Jason Roy has announced he'll take an indefinite break from cricket to spend time with his family. This comes a day after Roy, who was bought by Gujarat Titans, pulled out of IPL 2022 citing bio bubble fatigue. "Everything going on in the world over the last three years...[has] taken its toll on me," he had said.

116.title: Int'l players should be able to dominate at domestic level: Saba Karim
116.article_body: Referring to the performance of Cheteshwar Pujara, Ajinkya Rahane in the ongoing Ranji Trophy, ex-India cricketer Saba Karim said international level players should be able to dominate at the domestic level. "I'm not seeing it at the moment, and that is a concern," he added. Pujara and Rahane have scored 99 and 185 runs respectively in their two Ranji matches.

117.title: Mark my words, father-son duo will go to jail: Raut on BJP's Kirit, his son Neil
117.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that BJP leader Kirit Somaiya and his son Neil will go to jail for misusing Central agencies. This comes after Mumbai court rejected the anticipatory bail plea of Neil Somaiya in connection with the PMC Bank case. "If no crime committed, why is the father-son duo moving court for anticipatory bail?" Raut questioned.

118.title: 'Today is not my birthday,' tweets Punjab CM after PM Modi, others wish him
118.article_body: Several leaders including PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend birthday wishes to Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi on Tuesday. Channi later tweeted a clarification, saying, "Grateful for all the wishes pouring in for me today, however today is not my birthday." PM Modi had wished him "good health and long life".

119.title: Congress, JD(S) leaders will join BJP ahead of 2023 polls: K'taka CM
119.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that several leaders from Congress and Janata Dal (Secular) are in touch with the BJP and will be joining the party in the days to come ahead of the 2023 polls. Congress will not come to power in Karnataka for 10 more years, state BJP President Nalinkumar Kateel said.

120.title: IFS officer shares video of stranded bear being released into the wild
120.article_body: An Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer, Parveen Kaswan, shared a video of a stranded Himalayan black bear being released into the wild on Twitter. In the video, the bear that appears to be a cub leaps out of the cage and runs towards the forest cover. "Rescue work was successful without any injury to people or animal," Kaswan tweeted.

121.title: Even when I was fat, I had work: Richa Chadha on body transformation
121.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha revealed that even before her physical transformation, she didn't find it difficult to find work. She said that even when she was fat, she had work. "And now that I'm thin, I want to tell actors, aspiring actors...that you don't have to be a certain shape to continue to get work in the film industry," she added.

122.title: Two kids injured as ceiling of a govt school building collapses in TN
122.article_body: A portion of a ceiling at a government school in Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram collapsed injuring two kids aged eight and 10 on Tuesday. The district collector said six kids were playing inside the old school building whose demolition was under process when a wooden beam from the ceiling fell down. The two injured students were rushed to a government hospital.

123.title: Teams of teachers set up to visit homes of students back in Delhi from Ukraine
123.article_body: Two teams of teachers have been set up to be in touch with students who have returned to Delhi from Ukraine. Teams have been directed to visit homes of students who have returned from Ukraine after February 22 and "ensure all necessary steps are being taken for the welfare of students" and also visit families of students stuck in Ukraine.

124.title: Ukrainians line up at gun shops to buy rifles, shotguns amid Russian attack
124.article_body: Ukrainians are reportedly lining up at gun shops to buy rifles and shotguns amid attack by Russian forces. They are also getting trained in how to use the weapons inside the stores. Lviv police have simplified the procedure to buy weapons. The process which used to take two-three weeks can now be finished in two-three days, said a civilian.

125.title: Received India's request to evacuate Indians in Ukraine via Russian territory: Russia
125.article_body: Russian Ambassador-designate to India, Denis Alipov, has said, "We are in touch with the Indian authorities for Indians stranded in Kharkiv, and other areas of eastern Ukraine." "We have received India's request for emergency evacuation of all those stuck there via Russian territory," he further said. "India understands the depth of this crisis," he added.

126.title: BMC forms team to ensure early activation of centre for kids with special needs
126.article_body: The BMC has formed a task force for monitoring its recently announced facility to set up the first early intervention and rehabilitation centre for children with special needs. The task force will work towards early activation of the facility, an official said. The centre will provide medical facilities and therapies to children with any physical and mental disabilities.

127.title: Smriti Irani welcomes Indians evacuated from Ukraine in 4 regional languages
127.article_body: Union minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday welcomed Indians, who were evacuated from war-hit Ukraine under the Centre's Operation Ganga, in four different languages. In a video shared by her on Twitter, Irani was seen speaking in Malayalam, Bengali, Gujarati and Marathi aboard an IndiGo flight. She later said, "Welcome back home! We are grateful that our prayers have been heard."

128.title: I'm hoping he'll write a role for me: Upasana refutes rumours of rift with Kapil
128.article_body: Actress Upasana Singh refused rumours of a rift between her and comedian-actor Kapil Sharma. Upasana revealed she quit 'Comedy Nights With Kapil', which aired on Colors, because of commitment issues and not because she wasn't happy working with him. "Kapil and I...regularly communicate with each other. I'm hoping that he'll someday write a role for me," she added.

129.title: Fire breaks out at factory in Delhi's Narela, 4 fire engines rushed to spot
129.article_body: A fire broke out at a factory in north Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Wednesday, police said. Police received the information at about 11:03 am, following which four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. According to a senior police official, no person was reported to be inside the factory during the incident.

130.title: Russian forces destroy a maternity home in Ukrainian city, video surfaces
130.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs shared a video of Russian forces destroying a maternity home in Zhytomyr. "If it is not a genocide, what is that?" the ministry wrote. Two people reportedly died at the maternity home in the attack. The Russian invasion of Ukraine entered its seventh day on Wednesday.

131.title: Man lures 4-year-old girl with candies, rapes her in UP; arrested
131.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly raped in Uttar Pradesh by a man who frequently visited her house. The man had come to the girl's house on Monday. He lured her to come to his place by offering her candies and then raped her. The girl was found semi-conscious with injuries on her private parts.

132.title: Russia planning to spread fake news about Ukrainian surrender: Ukraine
132.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Tuesday said that the country believes Russia is preparing a mass disinformation campaign to suggest senior military and political figures have surrendered. "To 'confirm' this fake information, seemingly signed 'documents', as well as fake, edited videos will be distributed," he further said in an online statement.

133.title: Google blocks Russia media firms RT, Sputnik on app store in Europe
133.article_body: Google has announced that it has blocked mobile apps related to Russian state-run media firms RT and Sputnik from its app store in Europe. RT Deputy Editor-in-Chief Anna Belkina said the outlet's distribution has been cut by technology companies without giving any evidence that it reported falsehoods. YouTube channels connected to RT and Sputnik were also blocked across Europe earlier.

134.title: Won't allow deplorable conduct of Grover family to tarnish our reputation: BharatPe
134.article_body: While removing Ashneer Grover as an employee, founder and director, BharatPe said in a statement, "The board will not allow the deplorable conduct of the Grover family to tarnish BharatPe's reputation." The company alleged that his family engaged in "misappropriation of funds" and Ashneer submitted his resignation ahead of the board's plan to table the report on the governance review.

135.title: Grover family used company's money to fund their lavish lifestyles: BharatPe
135.article_body: BharatPe on Wednesday alleged that Ashneer Grover and family "grossly abused" company expense accounts to "enrich themselves and fund their lavish lifestyles". The Grover family created "fake vendors through which they siphoned money away from the company's account", it said in a statement. BharatPe removed Ashneer as a founder, a day after he resigned as MD and director.

136.title: Russia claims taking full control of Ukraine's Kherson
136.article_body: The Russian Ministry of Defence has claimed that its troops have taken full control of southern Ukrainian city of Kherson. Russian military command is in talks with the Kherson municipality and other municipal departments, the ministry added. The Russia-Ukraine war entered its seventh day today. Heavy shelling was reported in Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv as well.

137.title: 6,000 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine till Tuesday: V Muraleedharan
137.article_body: Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine and over 6,000 of them have been brought back till Tuesday, MoS MEA, V Muraleedharan, said on Wednesday. "Around 20,000 Indians were stuck in Ukraine. Of these, 4,000 people returned by 24th February. Till yesterday, over 2,000 more people have returned," Muraleedharan added.

138.title: Anti-vaccine protesters clash with police outside New Zealand Parliament
138.article_body: A clash broke out between anti-COVID vaccine mandate protesters and the police outside the Parliament in New Zealand's Wellington on Wednesday. The agitators reportedly set several tents on fire creating thick clouds of smoke in the air. The police used pepper spray on some of the protesters and started towing vehicles blocking the streets in the area.

139.title: 2 men arrested after police bust sex racket in Pune
139.article_body: The Pune City Police have arrested a 20-year-old man and a 26-year-old man from Jharkhand for allegedly operating a sex racket. The accused, Jayshankar Sav and Kuldip Mahto, were allegedly trafficking women from other states to Pune for flesh trade. Acting on a tip-off, police reportedly laid a trap at a hotel and arrested the alleged sex racketeers on Monday.

140.title: I used to plan my wicket celebrations, now I focus on making team win: Bumrah
140.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that when he was a youngster he used to get "overexcited" and "plan his celebrations" after taking wickets. "[Now], I try to focus on the job at hand...When the team has won...there's ample time to celebrate...my focus is on making the team win," he added. Bumrah has been named vice-captain for Sri Lanka Tests.

141.title: Appalled but not surprised: Ashneer Grover on BharatPe's allegations of fraud
141.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Wednesday said he is appalled by BharatPe's allegations of fraud and financial misdoing for a "lavish lifestyle" after the company said he's no longer an employee, founder or director. "I am appalled at the personal nature of the company's statement, but not surprised," said Ashneer. "The only thing lavish about me is my dreams," he added.

142.title: Not mandatory to seek resignation of any minister until crime proven: Jayant Patil
142.article_body: Maharashtra minister Jayant Patil said it's not mandatory to seek the resignation of any minister until the crime is proven. His statement comes as NCP's Nawab Malik has been arrested by the ED in connection with a money laundering case. "If everyday some kind of action is being taken against ministers, it isn't mandatory to seek their resignation," Patil added.

143.title: Australia’s wildfires caused a 1% loss in ozone, finds study
143.article_body: The 2019-2020 Australian bushfires resulted in depletion of the ozone layer, a study has found. As per the study, smoke that rose into the atmosphere due to these wildfires resulted in a 1% loss of ozone, an amount that usually takes 10 years to recover. Scientists have warned rising wildfires due to climate change may slow down ozone recovery further.

144.title: 2 men rape woman on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar
144.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two men on pretext of curing her of black magic in Palghar last week. The woman alleged that the accused said she was facing problems because of a black magic spell cast on her and claimed they would perform magic tricks to cure her sufferings. When she followed their instructions, they raped her.

145.title: HC to issue directions on pleas seeking removal of marital rape exception
145.article_body: Delhi High Court has said that it will issue directions on March 2 on the batch of pleas seeking criminalisation of marital rape and reserved its verdict in the case. The petitions filed challenged the exception to Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the criminal offence of rape.

146.title: I exploded on set, all actors became quiet: Bhansali on 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'
146.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he once "exploded" on the set of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' because he "wanted a certain atmosphere". "All the actors...became quiet. It was my way of giving those vibes to her [Alia]...Till date she doesn't know that this is what I did to get her into that space," he added.

147.title: Ukraine forces kill team of assassins who were plotting to murder President Zelenskyy
147.article_body: Head of Ukraine's National Security and Defense Council Oleksiy Danilov announced on television that a unit of Chechen assassins sent on a mission to murder Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has been "eliminated". "I can say that we received information from representatives of FSB (Russia's Federal Security Service) who have no desire to take part in this bloody war," Danilov added.

148.title: 2 men convicted for placing fence on railway tracks in Mumbai
148.article_body: A Mumbai court convicted two men in their thirties for placing a fence on railway tracks thus endangering lives. The accused had allegedly placed the fence between the Marine Lines and Charni Road railway stations in 2018. However, since they were arrested soon after the act, the court sentenced them to the period they had already undergone in custody.

149.title: 1 mn COVID vaccines expire in Guatemala as people refuse to take shot
149.article_body: Guatemala health authorities said over a million doses of Russia's Sputnik COVID-19 vaccine have expired because nobody was willing to take the shot. "We've tried to make available all the vaccines of different brands...Unfortunately, there has been a rejection among the public to vaccination," Health Minister Francisco Coma said, adding that the wasted shots cost the government about $11 million.

150.title: China conducts genocide, what more does Apple need to act: Meta ex-exec
150.article_body: Former Meta executive Alex Stamos in response to Apple's actions against Russia said, "The PRC [China] is conducting a genocide domestically; what more does Apple need to act?" "Apple has done more for...PRC than any other US tech company has done for any other authoritarian state," he added. Stamos said Apple prevents Chinese dissidents from installing secure messengers and VPNs.

151.title: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 Bihar districts contaminated: Economic Survey
151.article_body: Groundwater in rural areas in 31 out of 38 districts in Bihar is affected by arsenic, fluoride and iron contamination, state Economic Survey, 2021-2022, has revealed. "A total of 4,742 rural wards in 14 districts situated along the Ganga are...affected by arsenic contamination," the report added. The survey referred to the findings of the Public Health Engineering Department (PHED).

152.title: US First Lady Jill wears blue dress with sunflower in support of Ukraine
152.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden wore a blue dress featuring an embroidered sunflower on the sleeve as a tribute to Ukraine amid Russia's invasion. Blue is one of the colours of the Ukrainian flag, while the sunflower is the national flower of the country. Earlier, a video showing a Ukrainian woman giving sunflower seeds to Russian soldier went viral.

153.title: Putin's closest friend Abramovich is panicking, wants to sell Chelsea: Swiss billionaire
153.article_body: Calling Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich one of Vladimir Putin's closest advisers and friends, Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss said Abramovich is panicking like all other Russian oligarchs. "He's trying to sell all his properties in England. He also wants to get rid of Chelsea quickly," added Wyss. Wyss also said he has received an offer to buy the club from Abramovich.

154.title: Siblings on way to school hit by car with juvenile driver in Chandigarh
154.article_body: Two siblings, 17-year-old Jyoti and 15-year-old Suraj, were hit by a car being driven by a juvenile in Chandigarh's Mani Majra area on Tuesday. Jyoti suffered a fracture in one of her arms while Suraj received multiple injuries. The incident took place when the siblings were going to school. Police have started legal proceedings against the father of the driver.

155.title: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
155.article_body: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.

156.title: Husband had hernia surgery; he couldn't lift daughter for 2 months: Shriya
156.article_body: Actress Shriya Saran revealed her husband Andrei Koscheev had hernia surgery. Taking to Instagram, Shriya said that Andrei couldn't lift their daughter Radha for two months. Sharing a few pictures with her husband, Shriya wrote, "Thank you @theapollohospitals...for taking such good care of @andreikoscheev." Shriya also thanked actor Ram Charan's wife Upasana Kamineni Konidela, for helping them.

157.title: Japanese defence veterans volunteer to fight for Ukraine: Report
157.article_body: As many as 70 Japanese, including 50 former members of the country's Self-Defense Forces, have reportedly volunteered to fight for Ukraine against the Russian invasion. Ukraine's Embassy in Japan thanked the Japanese people in a social media post but said, "Any candidates for this must have experience in Japan's Self-Defence Forces or have undergone specialised training."

158.title: Middlesbrough knock out Spurs, Man Utd in consecutive rounds of FA Cup
158.article_body: Middlesbrough FC defeated Tottenham Hotspur 1-0 in their fifth round encounter of the FA Cup following a goal in the second half of extra time by Josh Coburn, having earlier knocked out Manchester United. United crashed out of the FA Cup after a 7-8 defeat on penalties in the fourth round, with Cristiano Ronaldo missing a penalty in the match.

159.title: IPL is the strongest T20 league: Usman Khawaja on IPL vs PSL debate
159.article_body: Sharing his opinion on debate over the better T20 league between IPL and PSL, Australian cricketer Usman Khawaja said IPL is the strongest league in the world adding that there's not really a contest. "They have all the world come to them and it is the only league in the world to have Indian cricketers," stated Khawaja.

160.title: When things are not going for you, people start talking: Harmanpreet Kaur
160.article_body: India Women ODI vice-captain Harmanpreet Kaur, who last scored an ODI ton in 2017, has said, "When things are not going for you, people start talking." Harmanpreet, however, also added her last two innings have given her a lot of confidence going into the Women's ODI World Cup. She scored a half-century and a century in her last two innings.

161.title: Delhi likely to receive light rainfall today and tomorrow: IMD
161.article_body: Delhi could expect light rainfall today and tomorrow due to western disturbance, the India Meteorological Department forecast showed. The maximum temperature in the national capital on Tuesday was at 26 degrees Celsius, which is likely to touch 28 degrees Celsius on Wednesday, the Met department said. Temperature in Delhi can go upto 30 degrees Celsius-mark by March 7, it added.

162.title: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
162.article_body: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.

163.title: Boeing suspends maintenance & technical support for Russian airlines
163.article_body: US planemaker Boeing said it's suspending "parts, maintenance and technical support for services for Russian airlines" as well as "major operations in Moscow". "As the [Ukraine-Russia] conflict continues, our teams are focused on ensuring the safety of our teammates in the region," a Boeing spokesperson said. Boeing on Monday had said it'd paused operations at its Moscow Training Campus.

164.title: Mumbai guard loses over a month's salary after wallet with ATM card stolen
164.article_body: A 62-year-old Mumbai-based security guard lost over ₹15,000, which is more than his month's salary, after his wallet along with ATM card was stolen while he was travelling on a local train, the police said. ATM PIN was written on the cover of the card, the complainant told police, adding that the thief withdrew the amount in three transactions.

165.title: Telangana records 152 new COVID-19 cases, highest in Hyderabad at 64
165.article_body: Telangana on Tuesday recorded 152 new COVID-19 cases, with Hyderabad reporting the highest number of cases at 64. Hyderabad was followed by the Mancherial district which reported 10 new cases. As many as 7,89,083 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Telangana so far. The state reported no COVID-19 deaths on Tuesday and the death toll so far remained at 4,111.

166.title: 'Jhund' breaks everything we have learnt in 20-30 years: Aamir Khan
166.article_body: Terming 'Jhund' as one of Amitabh Bachchan's "greatest films", Aamir Khan said, "I don't have words because it is a very surprising film. It breaks everything we've learnt in 20-30 years being in Bollywood." "I got up with a spirit and this film won't leave me," added Aamir. "It's very unique. I don't know how it got made," he stated.

167.title: It's my daughter's wedding: Pankaj Kapur confirms Sanah's wedding with Mayank
167.article_body: Actor Pankaj Kapur confirmed that his daughter Sanah Kapur is getting married. Sanah will tie the knot with actor Manoj Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar on Wednesday. Speaking to a portal, Pankaj said, "I don't want to talk much about this, but yes it's my daughter’s wedding." Actor Vivaan Shah also shared a video from her pre-wedding celebrations.

168.title: 2 men open fire at wedding in Punjab, threaten lawyer with videos; booked
168.article_body: Punjab police booked two men for allegedly opening fire in air during a wedding function in Kakka village in November 2021. According to complaint registered against them, the accused filmed the act and threatened a lawyer who had a property dispute with them by sending him the video on phone. The duo was reportedly inebriated when the incident happened.

169.title: He'll never come back, please save those who are alive: Brother of Indian killed in Ukraine
169.article_body: The elder brother of Naveen SG, the fourth-year medical student from Karnataka who was killed in the war in Ukraine, has said, "My brother will never come back but please save those who are alive." "Many parents are spending every minute anxiously," he added. Naveen's father also urged the government to bring back stranded students in Ukraine.

170.title: David Warner performs hook step of 'Bachchhan Paandey' song, Akshay Kumar reacts
170.article_body: Australia batter David Warner took to Instagram to share a video of himself performing hook step of 'Maar Khayegaa' song from Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey'. "How did I go @akshaykumar?" he wrote. "You've hit it out of the park brother," Akshay Kumar responded. "Friendship broken with Tollywood, now Bollywood is my best friend!" a fan jokingly commented on Warner's video.

171.title: 57 kg ganja seized from passengers on board trains entering Bengaluru
171.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) in Bengaluru seized 57 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh from passengers on board the Howrah Express and Kakinada Express between February 24 and February 26. "The harvest season has begun for ganja grown in Odisha, Andhra Pradesh and hence we're seeing...surge in smuggling activity," GRP Superintendent, Karnataka, Siri Gowri, told The New Indian Express.

172.title: Hollywood actor Sean Penn escapes Ukraine on foot; shares pic
172.article_body: Hollywood actor Sean Penn shared a picture as he escaped Ukraine on foot. "Myself & two colleagues walked miles to the Polish border after abandoning our car," he wrote. "Almost all the cars in this photo carry women & children only, most without any sign of luggage, and a car their only possession of value," he added.

173.title: Kerala HC upholds ban on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV
173.article_body: A division bench of Kerala High Court on Wednesday upheld the order on Malayalam news channel MediaOne TV's ban.
