Police said the city-based realtors, who were partners in business, were shot at by unidentified assailants on Tuesday. An official said that while one of them died on spot, the other was rushed to hospital and pronounced dead there. A search is on to nab the killers.

349.title: It's like massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs: Ukraine on Russian invasion
349.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, Ukrainian Ambassador Igor Polikha on Tuesday said, "It (Russian invasion) is like the massacre arranged by Mughals against Rajputs." "We are asking every time all influential world leaders, among them Modi Ji, to use every resource against Putin to stop bombing and shelling," he added. He also thanked India for starting humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

350.title: Manjrekar gets protection from arrest by Bombay HC in obscenity case
350.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted director-actor Mahesh Manjrekar protection from arrest in a case over the alleged shooting of obscene scenes involving minors in his Marathi film 'Nay Varan Bhat Loncha Kon Nay Koncha'. Earlier, an FIR was registered against the film's director Manjrekar and the team under the provisions of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act.

351.title: Civic poll violence in Bengal send out wrong message: TMC MP
351.article_body: Reacting to reports of violence amid civic body elections in Bengal, Trinamool Congress (TMC) MP Saugata Roy said that such incidents should have been avoided as they send "wrong message among masses". "We (TMC) will win based on...work done by us, there's no need for...violence," he added. As many as 108 municipalities in the state went to polls on Sunday.

352.title: Hyd Traffic Police offers discount on pending challans from March 1
352.article_body: A one-time discount on traffic challans pending against motorists is being offered by traffic police in Telangana to provide respite to vehicle owners. Hyderabad Traffic Police Joint Commissioner AV Ranganath said the decision was taken considering financial troubles faced by many due to the COVID-19 lockdowns in last two years. The discount will be applicable from March 1 to 31.

353.title: Second round of Russia-Ukraine talks to be held on March 2: Report
353.article_body: The second round of talks between Russia and Ukraine is planned for March 2, reported Russia’s TASS news agency. The first round of negotiations had taken place on the Ukrainian-Belarusian border near the Pripyat river on Monday. The meeting had ended conclusively while both sides said they would meet again in the coming days.

354.title: Shahid's sister Sanah to marry Mayank Pahwa in Mahabaleshwar: Report
354.article_body: Veteran actors Pankaj Kapur and Supriya Pathak's daughter and actor Shahid Kapoor's half-sister Sanah Kapur will get married to actors Manoj Pahwa and Seema Pahwa's son Mayank Pahwa on Wednesday in Mahabaleshwar, reported Pinkvilla. The report stated that the mehendi and sangeet functions were scheduled for Tuesday. Sanah and Mayank reportedly got engaged in January 2017.

355.title: PM Modi chairs 4th high-level meeting in 48 hrs on Ukraine crisis
355.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday chaired a high-level meeting on the Ukraine crisis after Russian invasion, the fourth such meeting to be held in the last 48 hours. The meeting was called after India confirmed that a 21-year-old Karnataka native, Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, died in shelling in Ukraine. Earlier, PM Modi also spoke with Naveen's family and offered his condolences.

356.title: BJP MP meets family of Karnataka student killed in Ukraine
356.article_body: Shivkumar Udasi, BJP MP from Haveri in Karnataka, on Tuesday met with the family of Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv amid the Russian invasion. "He was standing in the queue before a grocery shop when the Russian army fired at people," Naveen's friend said. "We'll try to bring his body to India," Karnataka CM said.

357.title: Interpreter breaks down while translating Ukrainian President's speech to EU
357.article_body: An interpreter for a news channel broke down and cried while translating Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's address to the European Parliament on Tuesday. CNN's interpreter is heard sniffling while translating Zelenskyy's speech detailing the deaths of children and the toll of the Russian invasion. "This is the price of freedom," the interpreter said while passing on Zelenskyy's message.

358.title: I'm glad Sanjay Kapoor is getting his due: Arjun on 'The Fame Game'
358.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said he's excited to see his uncle and actor Sanjay Kapoor doing series like 'The Fame Game'. "From seeing 'Akhiyaan Milaoon Kabhi' (song in film 'Raja') as a kid to...seeing the show with Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay chachu, it's like life coming full circle for him," Arjun stated. Arjun added he's glad Sanjay is getting his due.

359.title: Extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues: UN panel
359.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) report released on Monday said extreme climate conditions can cause mental health issues like anxiety, depression, acute traumatic stress etc. Citing some studies, report said mental health problems increased by 0.5% when average temperatures exceeded 30 degree celsius. It also found increased risk of suicide with rise in ambient temperature.

360.title: Germany aims to fulfil all power needs via renewable sources by 2035
360.article_body: Germany has aimed to fulfil all of its electricity needs through renewable sources by 2035, a government draft paper stated. According to the draft paper, the share of wind or solar power should reach 80% by 2030. This comes after government considered extending life-spans of coal and nuclear plants to cut dependency on Russian gas on February 27.

361.title: Indian embassy didn't reach out to students in Kharkiv: Father of Indian who died
361.article_body: The father of 21-year-old Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar, a medical student from Karnataka who lost his life in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv, alleged that no one from the Indian Embassy reached out to stranded Indian students in Kharkiv. His uncle claimed that Naveen was killed when he stepped out of his bunker to exchange currency and fetch some food.

362.title: 100th Test another feather in Kohli's cap: Bumrah ahead of Mohali Test
362.article_body: Talking about ex-India captain Virat Kohli playing his 100th Test in Mohali against Sri Lanka, beginning Friday, India Test vice-captain Jasprit Bumrah said, "It's another feather in his (Kohli's) cap." He added, "It's always a special achievement for a player...it's a testimony to his hard-work, dedication." Notably, Bumrah made his Test debut under Kohli in 2018.

363.title: Will deny port call of US sanctioned Russian oil tanker: Malaysia
363.article_body: Malaysian government on Tuesday said Russian-flagged oil tanker, Linda which was targeted by US sanctions will not be allowed to call at Kuala Linggi port. "The government will continue to review the situation for further action as may be required according to current government policies," the transport ministry added. However, the authorities didn't state government's position on US sanctions.

364.title: Pakistan logs 861 new COVID-19 cases, 18 deaths in last 24 hours
364.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Tuesday said the country reported 861 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 18 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to over 30,000. NCOC added out of 37,087 active cases, 988 patients were critical. Meanwhile, positivity rate has dropped to 2.29% from 2.56%.

365.title: Ensure no more lives are lost in Russia-Ukraine conflict: J'khand CM
365.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that he is "deeply saddened" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. CM Soren said, "Our thoughts and prayers are with the family members of the deceased student." He further urged PM Narendra Modi to ensure that no more lives are lost in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

366.title: What is Wagner Group, the Russian mercenaries said to be in Kyiv to kill Ukraine Prez?
366.article_body: Mercenaries from Wagner Group, a Russian private military company recently sanctioned by EU over human rights abuses, are reportedly in Kyiv to assassinate Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The company is believed to be used by Kremlin to carry out its strategic objectives, even though Russia denied such claims. Wagner was reportedly involved in beheading of Syria army deserters in 2017.

367.title: 34-hour wait at -5°C was worst part: Bihar student on return from Ukraine
367.article_body: A Bihar resident who returned from Ukraine on Tuesday said the worst part was the 34-hour wait at the Ukraine-Romania border. "I couldn't eat, drink or sleep. The temperature was -3°C to -5°C," the 21-year-old student added. He further said that there was no toilet or place to sleep and he saw some girls falling unconscious.

368.title: Reaffirms commitment to service: Odisha CM on BJD win in rural polls
368.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Tuesday said that the massive mandate for the BJD in the three-tier panchayat elections has strengthened the party's commitment to public service. The BJD has won in 766 of the 851 Zilla Parishad zones where the elections were held. "I thank the people from the core of my heart for their...support to...BJD candidates," Patnaik tweeted.

369.title: Shahid Kapoor charges ₹38 cr for film with Ali Abbas Zafar: Report
369.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor has reportedly charged ₹38 crore as his fee for his upcoming untitled action film with director Ali Abbas Zafar. "This is around 25% more than 'Jersey' and more than twice of what he had fetched for...'Kabir Singh'," a trade source told Bollywood Hungama. Shahid Kapoor began shooting for the film in November last year.

370.title: Pakistan-Australia series set to be played with 100% crowd capacity
370.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has been allowed by National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC) to conduct the all-format series between Pakistan and Australia in front of a 100% capacity crowd due to reduction in COVID-19 cases across the country. The series is scheduled to take place from March 4 to April 5, 2022, beginning with the first Test in Rawalpindi.

371.title: Dean of Kerala drama school arrested for raping student in his home
371.article_body: School of Drama and Fine Arts' Dean S Sunil Kumar was arrested in Thrissur on Tuesday for allegedly raping a student in his home on January 21. The victim lived with Kumar and his partner as she couldn't travel to her hometown. After the victim allegedly attempted suicide and mentioned the incident in the hospital, Kumar called her "mentally unstable".

372.title: We've a desire to see our kids alive, I think it's a fair one: Zelenskyy to EU
372.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the European Parliament on Tuesday, the sixth day of the Russian invasion. Appealing to the European Union to "prove you're with us", Zelenskyy said, "We have a desire to see our children alive. I think it's a fair one." He added, "We're fighting...for our land...our freedom, despite the fact that all [our] cities...are now blocked."

373.title: At one time, I didn't have ₹1,500 to pay for kid's school: Urvashi
373.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia has revealed that during her late teens, she required ₹3,000 but was paid half as makers said she only shot the first episode. "You feel 'What am I gonna do, I don't have ₹1,500 to pay for my child's education'," the actress added. Urvashi further said that looking back, she feels she has done well for herself.

374.title: Officials deployed to help Ukraine evacuees return home: K'taka CM
374.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the state has deployed two officials in Mumbai and New Delhi, to help Karnataka students arriving from Ukraine reach home without any hassle. "The Romanian border is getting crowded and a request has been made to make separate arrangements for Kannadigas," the CM added.

375.title: PM2.5 pollution-related deaths in India rose 2.5 times in 20 yrs: Report
375.article_body: Deaths due to PM2.5 pollution in India increased 2.5 times in the last two decades, according to a report by Centre for Science and Environment. The report, released by Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav, said India accounted for one of every four air pollution-related deaths in 2019. It added that 6.67 million people died due to air pollution in the world.

376.title: This board has no authority to even call my peon: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover
376.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as company's MD and board director, said, "I live life on my own terms. This board has no authority to even call my peon." He said, "I don't acknowledge this board. It's a contravention of every single law of the land." He added, "I will take this up to the Ministry of Corporate Affairs."

377.title: Do prove that you are with us: Ukrainian President asks for support from EU
377.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday urged the European Union to prove it supported the country amid the Russian invasion. "Do prove that you are with us. Do prove that you will not let us go. Do prove that you are indeed Europeans and then life will win over death and light will win over darkness," he said.

378.title: Hungary supports bid for Ukraine to become part of EU: Minister
378.article_body: Hungary is supporting an initiative by eight European Union (EU) leaders to start membership talks with Ukraine, Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó said on Tuesday, adding that Brussels should "put the issue on agenda". Presidents of Poland, Lithuania, Latvia and five other countries have called for expedited EU candidate status for Ukraine. Ukraine has signed an application to join EU.

379.title: PM Modi to unveil Shivaji Maharaj's statue in Pune on March 6
379.article_body: PM Narendra Modi during his visit to Pune on March 6 (Sunday) is likely to travel by metro rail and also unveil Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's statue at Pune Municipal Corporation headquarters, BJP office-bearers said. He will also inaugurate the two priority stretches of the metro rail project between Garware college to Vanaz and Dapodi to Pimpri, Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said.

380.title: Rohit Sharma buys personalised Lamborghini Urus worth over ₹3.10 crore, pics surface
380.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma has bought a personalised Lamborghini Urus car worth over ₹3.10 crore. The Blu Eleos Metallic Urus comes with a 22-inch Nath diamond-cut rims and Sportivo Leather interior in Nero Ade/Rosso Alala. Rohit also owns a BMW X3, Toyota Fortuner and a Skoda Laura, which was his first-ever car.

381.title: Saurabh Chaudhary wins gold in shooting World Cup, Russian flag removed from points table
381.article_body: India's 19-year-old Saurabh Chaudhary won the gold medal after defeating Germany's Michael Schwald in the final of 10 metre Air Pistol at ISSF Shooting World Cup in Cairo. The bronze medal in the event was won by Russia's Artem Chernousov. The Russian flag and country's name were removed beside Artem's name over Russia's ongoing war with Ukraine.

382.title: 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman Khan: Boney Kapoor
382.article_body: Bollywood producer Boney Kapoor has said that the sequel to the 2005 film 'No Entry' can only be made with actor Salman Khan. Boney stated that the script of the sequel is ready. "But 'No Entry Mein Entry' completely depends on Salman," he added. Talking about the film's script, Boney said, "It is 10 times funnier than 'No Entry'."

383.title: I'm fond of Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman, Nutan: Yami Gautam
383.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam in an interview has said that she is fond of the acting of veteran actresses Smita Patil, Waheeda Rehman and Nutan. The actress was asked about which actresses' career has inspired her. Yami further said that people are unaware of the struggles of actors, adding that she might not want to go through that actress' backstory.

384.title: UP CM Yogi offers prayers at Gorakhnath temple on Maha Shivaratri
384.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath offered prayers at the Gorakhnath temple on the occasion of Maha Shivaratri on Tuesday. Pictures have also surfaced online, showing the CM performing a ritual with a group of people inside the temple. Meanwhile, devotees in the state took holy dips and offered their prayers at Magh Mela in Prayagraj early morning on Tuesday.

385.title: Hyd police trace missing purse, hand it over to college student
385.article_body: Hyderabad Police helped trace a college student's purse after she reported it missing in the city's Shamirpet area. The student took to social media to share her experience and said she was helped immediately by the force. SHO of Bollaram police station, P Sreedhar, said ASI Sudarshan Sai and PC Shiva Shanker handed over the belonging to the victim.

386.title: Every minute is precious: Rahul after Indian student killed in Ukraine
386.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said "the government needs a strategic plan for safe evacuation" after Naveen Gyanagoudar, an Indian student, was killed in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. "Every minute is precious," Gandhi tweeted. The Centre recently launched Operation Ganga to evacuate Indians stranded in Ukraine. India has sent four ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to aid evacuation.

387.title: UP elections appear to be 'chhalia' versus Ballia: Akhilesh Yadav
387.article_body: While addressing an election meeting in the Phephana Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the ongoing Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections seem to be of "chhalia" (deceit) versus Ballia. "The BJP had promised to double the income of farmers if voted to power. Farmers should say if their income has doubled? Are the farmers getting fertilisers?" Yadav added.

388.title: Thailand to deploy labour to Saudi Arabia as bilateral ties normalise
388.article_body: Thailand will facilitate deployment of labour to Saudi Arabia for the first time in decades, its government said on Tuesday. Thai cabinet approved two draft agreements on legal labour recruitment for Saudi Arabia, which will protect the rights of workers and employers, a Thai government spokesperson said. This comes as the two countries agreed to re-establish diplomatic ties in January.

389.title: Philippines ease COVID-19 restrictions amid decline in daily caseload
389.article_body: Philippines on Tuesday relaxed COVID-19 restrictions amid a decline in number of daily cases. As per the ease in norms, public transport, businesses, malls, restaurants and theatres can operate at full capacity. However, the government mandated full vaccination for all residents above 18 and wearing of masks. Meanwhile, Philippines reported 1,067 new cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours.

390.title: NLUD launches new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health
390.article_body: The National Law University, Delhi (NLUD) has launched new-age digital courses on forensics, mental health, and technology law and policy. The courses have been launched by its centres Project39A and Centre for Communication Governance (CCG). Vice-Chancellor Srikrishna Deva Rao said that NLUD's focus, since its inception, "has been to look beyond normative legal studies patterns".

391.title: Over 1 million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines expire in Guatemala
391.article_body: Guatemalan health authorities on Monday said over one million Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccines have expired as nobody took the doses. There was "rejection" among population towards vaccine, said Health Minister Francisco Coma. However, he added it was unclear if hesitation was over Sputnik V or all vaccines. Meanwhile, only about 43% of the eligible population in Guatemala is fully vaccinated.

392.title: 4 students from B'luru build prototype to extract biodiesel using algae
392.article_body: Four school students from Bengaluru have built a prototype to extract biodiesel using algae. The students found that algae acts as a bioreactor sequester as it can capture and store carbon dioxide and they subsequently used the bioreactor to extract the biodiesel. They discovered that algae can be sustainably farmed from freshwater bodies and double in biomass over 24 hours.

393.title: Farhan Akhtar condoles death of Indian student killed in Ukraine
393.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar on Tuesday took to Twitter to condole the death of the Indian student killed in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. He wrote, "Feel terrible for the family...Hope we can get all our citizens home safe and soon." The Ministry of External Affairs has announced that it is in touch with the family of the student.

394.title: Kiren Rijiju leaves for Slovakia to oversee evacuation of Indians
394.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday boarded a SpiceJet flight for Slovakia to oversee the evacuation of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "As an envoy of PM Narendra Modi, we'll give his message to PM of Slovakia because without the help of their government we can't conduct this operation," he said. PM Modi spoke to his Slovakian counterpart on Monday.

395.title: Exploring ways to keep space station in orbit sans Russian help: NASA
395.article_body: NASA Human Spaceflight Program's Associate Administrator, Kathy Lueders, on Monday said NASA is exploring ways to keep International Space Station (ISS) in orbit without Russian help. However, she added orbiting research laboratory is yet unaffected by Russian invasion of Ukraine. This comes after Roscosmos chief hinted at pulling out of space partnership last week in response to US sanctions.

396.title: Seals in Antarctica help scientists to collect data under ice sheet
396.article_body: A group of eight Weddell seals helped Japanese researchers to survey waters and collect data such as water temperature and salt levels under thick ice sheet. Seals were equipped with 580g monitoring device on their heads that acted as a temperature and depth sensor. Project leader Nobuo Kokubun said such research helps scientists trace the animals' behavioural patterns and ecology.

397.title: Billionaire Founder of gaming company Nexon dies aged 54 in US
397.article_body: Kim Jung-ju, the billionaire Founder of Nexon, an online gaming company founded in South Korea, died at the age of 54 in United States late last month, Nexon's holding company NXC Corp said in a statement. Kim had been receiving treatment for depression and his condition seemed to have worsened recently, NXC said, without disclosing the cause of his death.

398.title: PM Modi speaks to the father of 21-yr-old Indian Medical student killed in Ukraine
398.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday spoke to the father of 21-year-old Indian Medical student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who died in shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv. Meanwhile, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "I know his family. They are very close to me. PM had spoken to the family. We'll try our best to recover the body and bring it back to India."

399.title: West must not build military facilities in ex-Soviet nations: Russia
399.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that the West must not build military facilities in any countries of the former Soviet Union. Russia found it unacceptable that some European countries hosted US nuclear weapons and was taking measures to prevent Ukraine from acquiring similar weapons, he added. Notably, several countries are sending weapons to Ukraine to fight the Russian forces.

400.title: Video shows diplomats walking out ahead of Russian minister's speech at UN forum
400.article_body: More than a dozen diplomats walked out ahead of a speech by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov at the UN Human Rights Council on Tuesday in protest of its invasion of Ukraine. A video of the incident showed the diplomats walking out as soon as Lavrov's speech starts to play on the screen. Lavrov was addressing the forum remotely.

401.title: 90% Indians who study medicine abroad fail to clear exam here: Minister
401.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday said that 90% of Indian students who go abroad for medical studies fail to clear the qualifying exam in India. He added, "This isn't the right time to debate why students are moving out to study medicine." He said the government is in touch with Ukraine and Russia and will soon bring students home.

402.title: Ukrainian civilians throw Molotov cocktail at Russian tank, video surfaces
402.article_body: A video has surfaced online that showed Ukrainian civilians throwing a Molotov cocktail at a Russian tank. In the clip, their car slowly approached the tank and threw the petrol bomb, following which, flames erupted and the car moved out of the area. Earlier, Ukraine had told its residents to make Molotov cocktails to "neutralise the occupier".
